CatDescriptText: Mary Eubanks, FEPC secretary, East Liberty and William Jefferson, Fifth Ward, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, May 21, 1960, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that racket squads eliminate vice and crime?" Mrs. Eubanks's answer reads: "No, it just shoves the rackets to another district.  The solution, I believe, is to legalize gambling."  Mr.Jefferson's answer reads: "Frankly, no.   The rackets are in full swing, I imagine."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Mary Eubanks wearing coat with jeweled swirl brooch and sunglasses, standing on sidewalk with pedestrians and buildings in background; Portrait of William Jefferson wearing v-neck sweater and hat, standing on Liberty Avenue, Gateway Center in background, Downtown
